intro: Psygmium elegans, commonly known as the elegant psyllium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant produces small, mucilaginous seeds that are used in traditional medicine and as a dietary supplement. It thrives in temperate climates and prefers well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
